root: ^"Hello again, don't suppose you've heard any word?"
^You decline to mention the fact you were never very sure who to look for in the first place.
^“I’m expecting a call, please forward it to my room.”
^“I’m going to need to take down a name please.”
^“Fine. It should be an associate of P. Pleasant Publishing.”
^“They will be wanting to hear about this situation.”
^He pauses to sigh. Doesn’t seem like this vacation is going very smoothly.
^“Oh, and if anyone phones under the name Aubrey, please tell them I am very disappointed in them right now.”
^“Might be worth breaking the news yourself honestly, instead of myself."
^You can’t deny being intrigued by this turn of events.
^“I’ll let you know if anyone calls!”

manager1: ^“Was my manager, is a more polite way to put it I suppose.”
^“Whilst I do hope they haven’t befallen any harm, I must say that it is rather fortunate they didn’t make it here with me.”
^“We often do not get on. Opposing views and such. Also they were very loud.”
^“This incident will not do wonders to improve my managerial relations.”
^“Especially if Aubrey happens to find their way here after all…”
manager2: ^“Thank you. I wouldn't suspect it would be before tomorrow morning, but just in case.”
job: ^“It’s really important I deal with this as soon as possible.”
^“It could put some strain on my career whilst I am on this little trip.”
^“Was it not obvious from my questioning? I’m an author, but I prefer the term novelist.”
^You can’t help but laugh at his hubris.
^“Come to think of it, your name does ring a bell.”
known1: ^“I rather think it should! M. Mothman is a household staple.”
^“If you read historical fiction, that is…”
^“I’ve written such classics as ‘The Dawning of the Lamp’ and ‘Beyond the Forest Trees Part 2 featuring new Addendums."
^You decide to let him keep spouting book titles at you. None of them instill any sort of recognition whatsoever.
known2: ^ He stares at you in mock offence. Silent. This is awkward…
^“You must be lying. I can’t believe it! Either that, or you have no taste.”
^“It seems I’ve come to expect that from this reception.”
^“I’m a multi award winning bestseller. Look me up.”
sc2end: ^“Anyway, enough about my infinitely successful career. I have a draft to review in my room that suddenly seems infinitely more interesting than this conversation. Adieu.”
^Well, he sure is a conversationalist. Make sure to keep an eye out for any phone calls.
